org.apache.flex.swf.io

Class InputBitStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • org.apache.flex.swf.io.InputBitStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class InputBitStream
extends InputStream
    Implementation of InputBitStream. This implementation allows you to swap the underlying InputStream source with another one.

    InputBitStream doesn't buffer the source InputStream internally. It has one byte buffer for reading SWF bit-values. The buffer is filled 8 bits at a time. All the bit value methods read from this buffer.

    If a SWF file is compressed, InputBitStream uses an InflaterInputStream to decompress the source input.

      • readByte

        protected int readByte()
        This helps to mute the IOException. If there's no data in the source input stream, calling this method will raise an runtime exception.

        All the methods implementing IInputBitStream should call this method when consuming the next byte from the input stream.

        Returns:
        next byte in the input stream

      • readFB

        public float readFB(int length)
        Read fixed-point bit values. Fixed-point bit values are 32-bit 16.16 signed, fixed-point numbers. That is, the high 16 bits represent the number before the decimal point, and the low 16 bits represent the number after the decimal point. A fixed-point bit value is identical to a signed-bit value, but the interpretation is different. For example, a 19-bit, signed-bit value of 0x30000 is interpreted as 196608 decimal. The 19-bit, fixed-point bit value 0x30000 is interpreted as 3.0. The format of this value is effectively 3.16 rather than 16.16.
        Parameters:
        length - number of bits to read
        Returns:
        integer

      • readFIXED

        public float readFIXED()
        Read 32-bit 16.16 fixed point number.

        fixed point number

      • readToBoundary

        public byte[] readToBoundary()
        Read all the bytes from the current position up to the read boundary. This is useful for reading SWF tags with variable length field at the end, like DoABC.
        Returns:
        byte array

      • getOffset

        public long getOffset()
        Get the offset of the read cursor.
        Returns:
        offset

      • setReadBoundary

        public void setReadBoundary(long offset)
        Set the read boundary. Reading beyond the boundary will raise exception.

        The read boundary can move forward and backward. This is because DefineSprite has nested tags. The read boundary for a DefineSprite tag is at the end of all the nested tags, but it moves backwards when starting to read the nested ones.

        Parameters:
        offset - boundary offset to the beginning of the stream.

      • getReadBoundary

        public long getReadBoundary()
        Get the read boundary.
        Returns:
        read boundary
